editorialNotes.standard: The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defence series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

The unstoppable, poppable Bloons series gets better with each installment, and this entry in the cute-but-cunning tower-defense franchise is no exception. Bloons TD 5 is adorable and quirky, but there’s an astonishing amount of content, tactical depth, and replayability to go along with the goofy weapons, helium-filled interlopers, and priceless monkey business.

editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you get out alive?

editorialNotes.standard: Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The game’s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TV—we feel like we’re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

editorialNotes.tagline: Don't let the zombies stop you

editorialNotes.standard: Sure, there are skateboarding games that let you pull 900s from telephone wires, then land in a manual, collecting millions of points. But when you want realism and complexity, you want True Skate. For years, True Axis’ skateboarding simulator has been letting us ollie, grind and kickflip with our fingers. Competing with your friends, scouting gaps and completing missions is great fun, but the true reward is perfecting a line and nailing incredible tricks with just the right swipes.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The concept behind Kingdom Rush Frontiers is exceptionally simple: take the same great ideas, visual style, and fiendishly difficult tower defense that millions fell in love with in the original game and improve it by adding tons of incredible content. Frontiers packs new heroes, settings, towers, and tons of fresh enemies to fend off, making the frenzied action even harder to put down.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Catchy music, incredible combo-filled combat, co-op play, and a blast of nostalgic spirit ensures this classic brawling series still packs a punch.

editorialNotes.tagline: Still trying to get over it TBH

editorialNotes.standard: Badland is an eerie sidescroller in which you guide a nondescript creature through creepy and perilous environments. Thanks to simple controls and obvious objectives, the game is instantly accessible, but winding levels and unique power-ups make each stage an exercise in careful timing and hasty strategies. As the gameplay evolves and becomes increasingly bizarre, Badland remains incredibly fun.
This acclaimed platformer motivates you to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: If they see you coming, it’s too late! Your mind is still your best weapon in the updated version of this sneaky 2006 action game.

editorialNotes.short: This stylish runner made a big impact when it first launched, and it's still a blast.

editorialNotes.tagline: Put an end to the terror

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: It’s not a bug, it’s a feature

editorialNotes.standard: Limbo is a gripping blend of stark, haunting landscapes, bizarre characters and unsettling sounds. With clever puzzle design, an intriguing narrative and an excellent touch-screen control system, it’s as rewarding to play as it is interesting to look at and listen to.
editorialNotes.short: Dark, haunting, beautiful. This'll stay with you long after it's over.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Explore endless vertical worlds controlling a four-legged alien.

editorialNotes.tagline: Or just bundle up and enjoy the ride.

editorialNotes.standard: A well is usually one of the last things we’d want to fall into, but this retro-style shooter has us jumping in again and again. It’s a rush descending from rock to rock, blasting creepy creatures with your gunboots while nabbing crimson gems. Roguelike difficulty means you’re in for a challenge, but superb controls and nifty upgrades (including a jetpack, a drone and laser sights) give you all the help you’ll need. And with randomly generated levels, each journey feels as fresh and exciting as the last.

You’re a goat, free to run wild and cause mayhem in a virtual town. And trust us: that premise leads to tons of hilarious moments and stunts. We’ve crashed parties, head-butted cars, bounced on trampolines, and done a million other goofy things in this outrageous sandbox game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: It only takes about five minutes to realize just how strange Severed is. But to rescue your family, you’re going to have to dive right in, mastering the excellent swipe-based combat, travelling through a magical realm filled with danger, and—yeah—collecting some severed limbs. Like we said, it’s a little weird. But this Apple Design Award winner is also gorgeous, atmospheric, and totally memorable.

editorialNotes.tagline: Clean up Gotham one brick at a time

name: Cut the Rope: Time Travel GOLD

ios.subtitle: Om Nom goes to the past

editorialNotes.standard: Defend temples by blasting shadowy horrors with spells and massive light beams in this stylish 2D action game.

editorialNotes.standard: Deliver packages to rebuild a ravaged society–and unravel supernatural mysteries–in this wild post-apocalyptic adventure crafted by legendary game maker Hideo Kojima.
